timeline.bodyText: It's not great that we just ignore the logging. When one enables the logging to see which files are open, it's not good that files open through this traverser are not logged.

timeline.message:
Publish hadoop module without relocation

We need 3 different hadoop modules:
- hazelcast-jet-hadoop-core - all our classes without relocation
should be used from other Jet modules, in combination with
hazelcast-jet-core

- hazelcast-jet-hadoop - for users, with relocated packages (Jackson),
to be used together with hazelcast-jet
users provide own version of hadoop

- hazelcast-jet-hadoop-all - same as previous, with all deps included
An attempt to fix Kafka Avro test
An attempt to fix Kafka Avro test
An attempt to fix Kafka Avro test
An attempt to fix Kafka Avro test
An attempt to fix Kafka Avro test

timeline.bodyText:
What about this more concise name?
filesHadoop(s3:///directory/*)

filesLocal(/directory/*.csv)

"files" + (shouldUseHadoop() ? "Hadoop" : "Local") + '(' + path + '/' + glob + ')'
timeline.author: viliam-durina
viliam-durina

timeline.bodyText: Is the only purpose of this class to be able to somehow pass the HazelcastTable object to place where the function is used? An explanatory comment would be good.
timeline.author: viliam-durina

timeline.bodyText: Was there an issue with reading the csv as String[]? Reading each line as a Map seems memory heavy. I didn't do any benchmarks though so it might be just a feeling.
timeline.author: frant-hartm

replies.bodyText: It was changed to support field subsets & different schemas per file. It's not much different from json where JrsObject stores a map internally.
replies.author: gierlachg

replies.bodyText: For json we should ideally use streaming parser that would extract the fields we're interested in.
replies.author: viliam-durina

timeline.bodyText:
The FileFormat#json should also be able to read regular json files, not only jsonl. It doesn't work currently (bug reported by ondrej).
Is the user expected to specify json or jsonl as format in SQL query? Maybe json would be more intuitive.
timeline.author: frant-hartm

timeline.bodyText: What happens when the first record you get for schema resolution has a field null, but other records have a int/double/string/ there.
timeline.author: frant-hartm

replies.bodyText: It's going to be resolved to OBJECT type and treated as such. Those are the downsides of automatic schema resolution.
replies.author: gierlachg

replies.bodyText: We should mention it in the docs I think.
replies.author: viliam-durina

timeline.bodyText: Does array fall under this? Are arrays supported by our SQL implementation?
timeline.author: frant-hartm

replies.bodyText: Yes, array falls under this. We don't support ARRAY as type but an array is still an object and you can for example IS NULL it.
replies.author: gierlachg

timeline.bodyText: Does this mean I can't query e.g. nested json fields?
timeline.author: frant-hartm

replies.bodyText: Correct, nested fields are not supported for any connector at the moment.
replies.author: gierlachg

timeline.bodyText:
This is a binary file checked into the repo.
It would be easier to maintain to generate the file on the fly during the test - e.g. when someone needs to add a field to the file, create a similar file with a specific corner case etc. If the code is there it can be easily modified. Otherwise one would need to create the file from scratch or maybe somehow modify it.
timeline.author: frant-hartm

timeline.message: Generate avro & parquet data on the fly
